Speaker.P: Limerick East): I propose to take Questions Nos. 667 and 668 together.

The £32,000 provided in 1984 is for the salary and travelling and subsistence expenses of a consultant who is employed under contract on a full time basis on design and planning work related to the national communications network being provided for the Garda Síochána.

The consultant was appointed by the Minister for Justice, with the sanction of the Minister for the Public Service, on the advice of the Expert Advisory Committee which has advised successive Ministers for Justice on all matters related to this communications project.

Of the £40,000 provided in 1985, £33,000 is for the continued employment of the consultant for the Garda communications project and £7,000 is for the employment of a psychologist on a consultancy basis to carry out a study of sex offenders in prisons and places of detention.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Garda Patrols.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gregory-Independent Mr. Gregory-Independent
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Justice if he will outline the steps that will be taken by the Garda to ensure there is no double parking or obstructions caused on Sundays along Whitworth Road, Dublin 9, when there are football matches in Croke Park.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Justice (Mr. Noonan, Limerick East) Michael Noonan
Speaker.P: Limerick East): The precise arrangements made for the policing of particular areas is a matter for the Garda authorities having regard to local circumstances, available resources and demands on Garda services.

MainHeading.P: I am informed by the Garda authorities that, on the occasion of matches in Croke Park, every effort is made to police all nearby streets as effectively as possible and that Whitworth Road is one of those that has been and will continue to be given particular attention so far as available resources permit.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Brady Mr. G. Brady
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Justice in view of the alarming increase in vandalism and housebreaking in the locality of St. Kevin's parish, Dublin 8, if he will outline the action which can be taken to combat this problem; and if he will arrange to examine the question of providing more Garda patrols on the beat in his locality.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Justice (Mr. Noonan, Limerick East) Michael Noonan
Speaker.P: Limerick East): The precise arrangements for the policing of particular areas are a matter for the Garda authorities and the allocation of Garda manpower between foot patrols and other duties in any particular area is a matter for the local Garda officers having regard to available resources, local circumstances and other demands on Garda services.

The Garda authorities inform me that extra gardaí have been assigned to Kevin Street station and that there has been an increase in the level of foot patrolling in the St. Kevin's parish area during the past two months. In addition, the area is receiving regular attention from mobile patrols operated from the local station and by the crime task force based at Harcourt Square. I understand that the local Garda community relations inspector is in regular contact with local residents' associations and that he will be attending a meeting of St. Kevin's Community Council arranged for tomorrow at which crime and vandalism in the area will be discussed.

As regards the incidence of crime in the St. Kevin's parish area, the Garda authorities report that provisional crime figures for 1984 to date show a downward trend in the level of crime in the area as compared with 1983.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Consultancy Services.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Kennedy Mr. O'Kennedy Mr. Wallace Mr. Wallace
Speaker.P: and Mr. O'Kennedy asked the Minister for Education if she will give details of the expenditure of £300,000 on consultancy work estimated for her Department in 1985; the number of people who will be employed on this work; and how they will be recruited.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The sum of £300,000 which has been provided for expenditure on consultancy work in 1985 has been allocated for the design and implementation of a computer system to assist in the running of the intermediate and leaving certificate examinations.

The recruitment of a firm of consultants for work on the design of a system is under way at present. Pending the selection of a firm, it is not possible to say how many people will be employed on the project. The number involved in a consultancy project of this nature however would be small.

The recruitment procedures used by my Department are those outlined by the Department of the Public Service Booklet, entitled Employing Management Consultants — Code of Practice for Government Departments.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Clare Community College.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Kennedy Mr. O'Kennedy
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will sanction the proposal for a new urgently needed community college in Killaloe, County Clare.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Documentation relating to the bill of quantities stage of planning of the proposed new community college at Killaloe, Co. Clare, is at present under examination in the Department.

Pending the completion of the planning process, and review of the overall second level school building programme, in the context of the available capital, and the Department's commitments and priorities, it is not possible to say when approval may be given for the seeking of tenders.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Wexford National School.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Browne Mr. Browne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the up-to-date position regarding the proposed extension to Kiltealy national school, Kiltealy, County Wexford.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: My Department have approved a sketch scheme for the extension to Kiltealy national school, County Wexford. As soon as agreement has been reached with the school authorities on the level of the local contribution to the cost of the project, and satisfactory evidence of title to the site extension has been furnished formal sanction of the grant will be issued by my Department and architectural planning of the project will proceed to the detail design stage.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Consultancy Services.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Kennedy Mr. O'Kennedy Mr. Wallace Mr. Wallace
Speaker.P: and Mr. O'Kennedy asked the Minister for Labour if he will give details of the expenditure of £20,000 on consultancy services in 1984; the number of people employed on this work; and how these people were recruited.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: £20,000 is the provision for consultancy services under subhead A3 of my Department's Vote for 1984. To date there has been expenditure of £7,608.25 as follows:
(a) £7,226.25 to a firm of consultants engaged to provide an independent assessment of the financial position of Dublin port for the Dublin Docks Review Group set up by me;
(b) £72 to a research body for services provided by a member of their staff for my Department;
(c) £50 to a medical consultant for a report on an accident;
(d) £260 to a consultant for professional advice in connection with an industrial safety question.
The consultants were engaged on the basis of their relevant expertise.
